trans-unit.source: Manage API apps
trans-unit.target: Manage API apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage Azure App Service API apps by using the Azure portal and Visual Studio Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage Azure App Service API apps by using the Azure portal and Visual Studio Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Manage API apps in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Manage API apps in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This article shows how use the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> to perform API app management and monitoring tasks.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how use the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> to perform API app management and monitoring tasks.

trans-unit.source: Here are some of the tasks you can do:
trans-unit.target: Here are some of the tasks you can do:

trans-unit.source: Configure authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure authentication

trans-unit.source: Enable auto-scaling
trans-unit.target: Enable auto-scaling

trans-unit.source: View logs
trans-unit.target: View logs

trans-unit.source: See how many requests are made and see how much data is being used by an API app
trans-unit.target: See how many requests are made and see how much data is being used by an API app

trans-unit.source: Backup an API App and create alerts
trans-unit.target: Backup an API App and create alerts

trans-unit.source: Configure role-based access security
trans-unit.target: Configure role-based access security

trans-unit.source: The article also shows how to do some management tasks in the Server Explorer window in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The article also shows how to do some management tasks in the Server Explorer window in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: API app and gateway blades in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: API app and gateway blades in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: In Azure App Service an API app is a <link><linkText>web app</linkText><title></title></link> that has additional features for hosting web services.
trans-unit.target: In Azure App Service an API app is a <link><linkText>web app</linkText><title></title></link> that has additional features for hosting web services.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, there is an API app blade for managing the API-specific features, and an API App host blade for managing the underlying web app.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, there is an API app blade for managing the API-specific features, and an API App host blade for managing the underlying web app.

trans-unit.source: Every resource group that contains at least one API app also includes a gateway.
trans-unit.target: Every resource group that contains at least one API app also includes a gateway.

trans-unit.source: The gateway acts as a proxy, handling authentication and other administrative functions for all API apps in a resource group.
trans-unit.target: The gateway acts as a proxy, handling authentication and other administrative functions for all API apps in a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Like an API app, a gateway is a web app with extra functionality, so there are also two portal blades for managing the gateway: a Gateway blade for gateway-specific functions, and a Gateway host blade for managing the underlying web app.
trans-unit.target: Like an API app, a gateway is a web app with extra functionality, so there are also two portal blades for managing the gateway: a Gateway blade for gateway-specific functions, and a Gateway host blade for managing the underlying web app.

trans-unit.source: Tasks you can do only on the API App blade
trans-unit.target: Tasks you can do only on the API App blade

trans-unit.source: You use the API app blade for the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: You use the API app blade for the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Configure access level - Click Settings > Application settings.
trans-unit.target: Configure access level - Click Settings > Application settings.

trans-unit.source: The default value is internal, which means only API apps in the same resource group are allowed to call the API app.
trans-unit.target: The default value is internal, which means only API apps in the same resource group are allowed to call the API app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Protect an API app</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Protect an API app</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure update policy - Click Settings > Application settings.
trans-unit.target: Configure update policy - Click Settings > Application settings.

trans-unit.source: Default value is On.
trans-unit.target: Default value is On.

trans-unit.source: This means that when a new version of the API app is published to the marketplace, your API app will automatically be updated to the new version if it is a non-breaking change.
trans-unit.target: This means that when a new version of the API app is published to the marketplace, your API app will automatically be updated to the new version if it is a non-breaking change.

trans-unit.source: Configure authentication for outgoing calls from the API app - Click Settings > Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Configure authentication for outgoing calls from the API app - Click Settings > Authentication.

trans-unit.source: If the API app makes calls to an external service that requires authentication, the required configuration values are entered here.
trans-unit.target: If the API app makes calls to an external service that requires authentication, the required configuration values are entered here.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Dropbox connector requires a client ID and a client secret to access the Dropbox service.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Dropbox connector requires a client ID and a client secret to access the Dropbox service.

trans-unit.source: Configure RBAC - Click Settings > Users.
trans-unit.target: Configure RBAC - Click Settings > Users.

trans-unit.source: User access that you configure here determines only who can access the API-app-specific features.
trans-unit.target: User access that you configure here determines only who can access the API-app-specific features.

trans-unit.source: To configure RBAC for the web app features, use the API app host blade.
trans-unit.target: To configure RBAC for the web app features, use the API app host blade.

trans-unit.source: Normally you would want to keep the RBAC settings for the API app and the API app host in sync.
trans-unit.target: Normally you would want to keep the RBAC settings for the API app and the API app host in sync.

trans-unit.source: If you give someone access to the API app but not the API app host, they won't be able to use the features on the API app blade that actually pertain to the API app host.
trans-unit.target: If you give someone access to the API app but not the API app host, they won't be able to use the features on the API app blade that actually pertain to the API app host.

trans-unit.source: View API definition - Click API definition in the Summary section to see a list of the methods exposed by the API app.
trans-unit.target: View API definition - Click API definition in the Summary section to see a list of the methods exposed by the API app.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Install the Hybrid Connection Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Install the Hybrid Connection Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Connection Manager gives you the ability to connect to an on-premises system, like SQL Server or SAP.
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Connection Manager gives you the ability to connect to an on-premises system, like SQL Server or SAP.

trans-unit.source: This hybrid connectivity uses Azure Service Bus to connect and control the security between your Azure resources and your on-premises resources.
trans-unit.target: This hybrid connectivity uses Azure Service Bus to connect and control the security between your Azure resources and your on-premises resources.

trans-unit.source: Tasks you can do on both the API app blade and the API app host blade
trans-unit.target: Tasks you can do on both the API app blade and the API app host blade

trans-unit.source: The API app blade enables you to do many tasks that pertain to the underlying web app.
trans-unit.target: The API app blade enables you to do many tasks that pertain to the underlying web app.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can do the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can do the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Stop, start, and restart the web app that hosts the API app.
trans-unit.target: Stop, start, and restart the web app that hosts the API app.

trans-unit.source: Select Requests and errors to add different performance metrics including commonly-known HTTP error codes, like 200, 400, or 500 HTTP status codes.
trans-unit.target: Select Requests and errors to add different performance metrics including commonly-known HTTP error codes, like 200, 400, or 500 HTTP status codes.

trans-unit.source: See response times, see how many requests are made to the API App, and see how much data comes in and how much data goes out.
trans-unit.target: See response times, see how many requests are made to the API App, and see how much data comes in and how much data goes out.

trans-unit.source: Create email Alerts if a metric exceeds a threshold of your choosing.
trans-unit.target: Create email Alerts if a metric exceeds a threshold of your choosing.

trans-unit.source: See how much CPU is used by the API App, review the current Usage Quota in MB, and see your maximum data usage based on your cost tier.
trans-unit.target: See how much CPU is used by the API App, review the current Usage Quota in MB, and see your maximum data usage based on your cost tier.

trans-unit.source: See Estimated spend to determine the potential costs of running your API App.
trans-unit.target: See Estimated spend to determine the potential costs of running your API App.

trans-unit.source: View the application logs and other IIS logs, including web server logs and FREB logs.
trans-unit.target: View the application logs and other IIS logs, including web server logs and FREB logs.

trans-unit.source: Select Processes to open Process Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Select Processes to open Process Explorer.

trans-unit.source: This shows your web instances and their properties, including thread count and memory usage.
trans-unit.target: This shows your web instances and their properties, including thread count and memory usage.

trans-unit.source: These tasks can also be done by using the API app host blade.
trans-unit.target: These tasks can also be done by using the API app host blade.

trans-unit.source: This is why the two blades share much of the same UI.
trans-unit.target: This is why the two blades share much of the same UI.

trans-unit.source: For example, The Stop, Start, and Restart buttons on the API app blade have exactly the same effect as the Stop, Start, and Restart buttons on the API App Host blade.
trans-unit.target: For example, The Stop, Start, and Restart buttons on the API app blade have exactly the same effect as the Stop, Start, and Restart buttons on the API App Host blade.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, the monitoring information provided on the API app blade is the same as what the API app host blade shows.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, the monitoring information provided on the API app blade is the same as what the API app host blade shows.

trans-unit.source: The only functions provided on API app blade that are not duplicates from the API app host blade are listed in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: The only functions provided on API app blade that are not duplicates from the API app host blade are listed in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: Tasks you can do only on the API app Host blade
trans-unit.target: Tasks you can do only on the API app Host blade

trans-unit.source: You use the API App Host blade for all of the tasks that you would do for any web app.
trans-unit.target: You use the API App Host blade for all of the tasks that you would do for any web app.

trans-unit.source: Tasks you can do only on the gateway blade
trans-unit.target: Tasks you can do only on the gateway blade

trans-unit.source: You use the Gateway blade for the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: You use the Gateway blade for the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Authentication provider configuration for incoming calls to API apps - Click Settings > Identity.
trans-unit.target: Authentication provider configuration for incoming calls to API apps - Click Settings > Identity.

trans-unit.source: If the gateway needs to authenticate users before allowing them to call API apps in the resource group, the required configuration values are entered here.
trans-unit.target: If the gateway needs to authenticate users before allowing them to call API apps in the resource group, the required configuration values are entered here.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure and test a SaaS connector in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure and test a SaaS connector in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure RBAC - Click Settings > Users.
trans-unit.target: Configure RBAC - Click Settings > Users.

trans-unit.source: User access that you configure here determines only who can access the gateway-specific features, not the features shared with all web apps.
trans-unit.target: User access that you configure here determines only who can access the gateway-specific features, not the features shared with all web apps.

trans-unit.source: Tasks you can do on both the gateway blade and the gateway host blade
trans-unit.target: Tasks you can do on both the gateway blade and the gateway host blade

trans-unit.source: The gateway and gateway host blades share UI the same as the API app and API app hosts blades.
trans-unit.target: The gateway and gateway host blades share UI the same as the API app and API app hosts blades.

trans-unit.source: Tasks you can do only on the gateway host blade
trans-unit.target: Tasks you can do only on the gateway host blade

trans-unit.source: You use the Gateway Host blade for all of the tasks that you would do for any web app.
trans-unit.target: You use the Gateway Host blade for all of the tasks that you would do for any web app.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to navigate to API app and gateway blades
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to navigate to API app and gateway blades

trans-unit.source: One way to get to the API App blade is through the Azure portal's browse feature.
trans-unit.target: One way to get to the API App blade is through the Azure portal's browse feature.

trans-unit.source: In the portal home page, click Browse > API Apps to see all the API apps that you can manage.
trans-unit.target: In the portal home page, click Browse > API Apps to see all the API apps that you can manage.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the API app blade
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the API app blade

trans-unit.source: When you click a row in the API Apps list blade, the portal displays the API App blade.
trans-unit.target: When you click a row in the API Apps list blade, the portal displays the API App blade.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the API app host blade
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the API app host blade

trans-unit.source: To get to the API App Host blade, click API app host in the API App blade.
trans-unit.target: To get to the API App Host blade, click API app host in the API App blade.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Gateway blade
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Gateway blade

trans-unit.source: To get to the Gateway blade, click the Gateway link in the API App blade.
trans-unit.target: To get to the Gateway blade, click the Gateway link in the API App blade.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Gateway host blade
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Gateway host blade

trans-unit.source: To get to the Gateway Host blade, click the Gateway host link in the Gateway blade.
trans-unit.target: To get to the Gateway Host blade, click the Gateway host link in the Gateway blade.

trans-unit.source: Access API apps in Server Explorer in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Access API apps in Server Explorer in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer in Visual Studio you can start a remote debugging session, view streaming logs, and click a menu entry that opens the API app blade in the portal.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer in Visual Studio you can start a remote debugging session, view streaming logs, and click a menu entry that opens the API app blade in the portal.

trans-unit.source: To get to an API app in Server Explorer, click Azure > App Service > [the resource group name] > [the API app name], as shown in the illustration.
trans-unit.target: To get to an API app in Server Explorer, click Azure > App Service > [the resource group name] > [the API app name], as shown in the illustration.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This article has shown how to use the Azure portal to perform management tasks for API apps.
trans-unit.target: This article has shown how to use the Azure portal to perform management tasks for API apps.

trans-unit.source: For API apps that you install from the API app gallery, see also <link><linkText>Manage and monitor your built-in API apps and connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For API apps that you install from the API app gallery, see also <link><linkText>Manage and monitor your built-in API apps and connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to manage API apps by using the command line, see the articles in the Automate section of the menu that appears on the left side of the article (on wide browser windows) or at the top of the article (on narrow browser windows).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to manage API apps by using the command line, see the articles in the Automate section of the menu that appears on the left side of the article (on wide browser windows) or at the top of the article (on narrow browser windows).
